item.title: I worked at Google for -10 days
item.description: The article describes the author's experience of being laid off from Google ten days before starting their SRE position in London due to a wave of layoffs, which was a difficult process as they had already quit their previous job and prepared for the move.

item.title: Substack Notes Launched
item.description: Substack has launched 'Notes' to all users, a new space where writers and creators can publish short-form posts and share ideas, and it will help work travel through the Substack network for new readers to discover.

item.title: We're building a browser when it's supposed to be impossible
item.description: Andreas Kling discusses the process of building the Ladybird browser, which has made significant progress despite being considered an impossible task.

item.title: SQL Maxis: Why We Ditched RabbitMQ & Replaced It with a Postgres Queue
item.description: Prequel introduced a new queue built on top of Postgres database, replacing RabbitMQ, which improved system reliability and resiliency, and centralizing the application state.

item.title: Anthropic's $5B, 4-year plan to take on OpenAI
item.description: Sorry, the text provided does not contain any information relevant to the task given.

item.title: Sponsor the open source projects you depend on
item.description: 'Thanks.dev' is an open source funding platform.

item.title: The end of a myth: Distributed transactions can scale
item.description: A new paper presented at VLDB'17 introduces NAM-DB, a scalable distributed database system that uses remote direct memory access (RDMA) and a timestamp oracle for snapshot isolation (SI) transactions, achieving linear scale-out for throughput and low latency.

item.title: Supabase Edge Runtime: Self-Hosted Deno Functions
item.description: Supabase has released the Edge Runtime, a self-hosted solution for Deno Edge Functions that improves local development experience, enforces memory/duration limits, and serves all functions.

item.title: People with severe mental illness have been failed by a dysfunctional system
item.description: Jonathan Rosen's article in The Atlantic tells the story of his childhood friend, Michael, and highlights the flaws of America's mental health care system, calling for reform that provides adequate care and support to those in need, emphasizing early intervention and cultural change.

item.title: It happened to me today: $80/hr writer replaced with ChatGPT
item.description: An $80/hr freelance writer lost their job to ChatGPT, an AI language model, highlighting the impact of automation on the writing industry.

item.title: Deck.of.cards
item.description: The 'Deck.of.cards' post is about an HTML5 Deck of Cards.

item.title: Rules for developers to design beautiful UIs without a designer
item.description: Full-stack developer Adam Wathan and designer Steve Schoger have developed Refactoring UI, a comprehensive design package including a 218-page book, video tutorials, a gallery of 200+ component styles, color palettes, fonts, and SVG icons.

item.title: Distributed Machine Learning Notebooks with Elixir & Livebook
item.description: The Livebook Launch Week's second day introduces Livebook v0.9's new machine learning capabilities, including distributed machine learning with Nx that can be GPU-accelerated and distributed to multiple machines with minimal code adjustments.

item.title: Maximizing the Potential of LLMs: A Guide to Prompt Engineering
item.description: The article explores Language Models (LLMs), including their strengths, weaknesses, and prompt engineering strategies for specific tasks such as text summarization, question answering, code generation, and reasoning.

item.title: The Best Pens for 2023: Gel, Ballpoint, Rollerball, & Fountain Pens
item.description: JetPens has released a comprehensive guide named "The 42 Best Pens for 2023," consisting of various categories of pens.

item.title: Htmx 1.9.0 has been released
item.description: Htmx has released version 1.9.0, featuring support for view transitions and generalized inline event handling.

item.title: The Coming of Local LLMs
item.description: Despite advances in large language models (LLMs) trained on larger GPU clusters, there is still a need for running smaller models on devices with memory and processing power constraints.

item.title: FreeBSD 13.2
item.description: FreeBSD 13.2-RELEASE notes detail updates to the FreeBSD kernel and userland, including security advisories and changes on the 13-STABLE development line.

item.title: YouTube suspends a YouTuber's Patreon-exclusive account for self-impersonation
item.description: YouTube has suspended a YouTuber's Patreon-exclusive account after accusing the creator of self-impersonation.

item.title: KDE Plasma Widget for external monitor brightness adjustment
item.description: The article explains how to set up a KDE Plasma Widget for external monitor brightness adjustment using the `ddcutil` command-line utility.

item.title: GPT-4 gets a B on my quantum computing final exam
item.description: Scott Aaronson's GPT-4 AI scored a B on an undergrad quantum computing exam, with strengths in true/false and conceptual questions, according to a blog post by Aaronson.

item.title: Show HN: Skip the SSO Tax, access your user data with OSS
item.description: OpenOwl is an open-source tool that enables one to download user lists and additional user data from various SaaS applications without the need for a public API.

item.title: Make Something Wonderful â€“ Steve Jobs in his own words
item.description: Make Something Wonderful is a book from the Steve Jobs Archive that includes a collection of his speeches, interviews, and correspondence.

item.title: Colorado passes agricultural Right to Repair
item.description: Colorado has passed the first-ever agricultural Right to Repair bill, allowing farmers to access the necessary tools, diagnostics, and documentation to repair their tractors and other agricultural equipment.

item.title: The EU proposed CRA law may have unintended consequence for the Python ecosystem
item.description: The Python Software Foundation is concerned about the EU's proposed Cyber Resilience Act and Product Liability Act, stating that it may put the open-source software community at risk.

item.title: Elizabeth Holmes loses bid to stay out of prison
item.description: Elizabeth Holmes, the disgraced CEO of Theranos, has lost her bid to remain out of federal prison while she appeals her conviction for fraud.

item.title: Ask HN: Is the job market brutal? or is it just me?
item.description: The Ask HN post asks whether the tech job market is brutal or if it's just the poster's failure.

item.title: Open source & the future of nuclear physics
item.description: I'm sorry, but there is no text given for me to summarize.

item.title: Rust, RR, Neovim: A perfect debug combination
item.description: The post introduces `rrust.nvim`, a Rust helper tool that records and replays Rust test execution using `termdebug`.

item.title: The Free Software Foundation is dying
item.description: The Free Software Foundation (FSF), one of the longest-running missions in the free software movement, is failing to disseminate free software philosophy, promote copyleft licenses, and oversee the health of the free software movement, despite its accomplishments in establishing and advancing software freedom.
